meanings.definition: To become browned or discolored by exposure to the sun.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, his skin imbrowned from the sun.
meanings.sent2: The apples imbrowned quickly under the hot summer sun.
meanings.sent3: The picnic blanket imbrowned nicely after a day at the beach.
meanings.sent4: Her hair imbrowned like autumn leaves in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The old book imbrowned on the windowsill over time.

meanings.definition: To cause to become browned or discolored by exposure to the sun.
meanings.sent1: She carefully imbrowned the paper edges for her art project.
meanings.sent2: The gardener imbrowned the fence panels for a rustic look.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally imbrowned the bread crusts, but they tasted great!
meanings.sent4: The artist imbrowned the canvas with a touch of golden paint.
meanings.sent5: He imbrowned the wooden furniture to give it an antique appearance.
